intro: Sacciolepis semienensis, commonly known as the Semien sacciolepis, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, thriving in cool and moist environments. It has hairy leaves and produces blue or purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
